briefTitle: Clinical Study to Evaluate the Efficacy, Safety and Immunogenicity of an MF59-Adjuvanted Quadrivalent Influenza Vaccine Compared to Non-influenza Vaccine Comparator in Adults ≥ 65 Years of Age
officialTitle: A Phase III, Randomized, Observer-Blind, Controlled, Multicenter Clinical Study to Evaluate the Efficacy, Safety and Immunogenicity of an MF59-Adjuvanted Quadrivalent Influenza Vaccine Compared to Non-influenza Vaccine Comparator in Adults ≥ 65 Years of Age

interventions.name: MF59-adjuvanted Quadrivalent Subunit Inactivated Egg-derived Influenza Vaccine (aQIV)

summary: A Phase III, Randomized, Observer-Blind, Controlled, Multicenter Clinical Study to Evaluate the Efficacy, Safety and Immunogenicity of an MF59-Adjuvanted Quadrivalent Influenza Vaccine Compared to Non-influenza Vaccine Comparator in Adults ≥ 65 Years of Age.

primaryOutcome.measure: Absolute Vaccine Efficacy (VE) of aQIV Versus Non-influenza Comparator Based on RT-PCR-confirmed Influenza Due to Any Strain Using Protocol Defined ILI Definition.
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Day 21 to Day 180 after vaccination or end of influenza season, whichever is longer
